text: You might have to go a different route, then. Maybe try a google link tracking code? Or a js script to change the markup of a simple cta (and give that cta a class)
Hi, in my theme the tag `{{ required_head_tags }}` is rendering a <script> that I want to get rid of it. How can I find where this <script> is?
what is the name of the script?
Its the linkedin tag in the print below
`{{ content.widgets.name_of_module.body.parameter }}` syntax is not working with global modules. How do we access global module data in the template?
unconnect the portal from linkedin and/or get rid of any social follow modules
I’d give that a try first
<@U3T21PDBK> It was a social follow module, now the tag is gone! Thanks :+1:
Yeah, I wish ctas weren’t so difficult to implement. Maybe I am overthinking this….

Hi all,
does anyone know of a way I can colour code blogs based on their tag?
for example in my case a blog tagged with "Security" would have a blue button and title, while a blog tagged with "Safety" would have a red button and title

I was hoping I could do something like this:
`<div class="blog-index__post {% if blog_tag.security %}Security-Blog{% endif %}">`
but I haven't been able to find anything in the documentation that would achieve this
